title: Reddy loses Bagepalli MLA post with false claim of ‘nil’ tax dues when he actually owed over ₹1.3 crore
content: Declaring ‘nil’ tax dues in the assets and liabilities statement filed with his nomination papers - despite owing ₹1.3 crore in property tax arrears since 2018 - cost S.N. Subba Reddy his MLA post

title: All accused in father-son duo murder during Bemetara communal violence acquitted
content: Seventeen men were arrested for murdering an elderly man and his son, cattle grazers from Biranpur village in Chhattisgarh, in 2023

title: Black box of aircraft from Ajit Pawar’s crash sustained damage
content: A Learjet 45 crashed in Baramati, Maharashtra, on January 28, killing Pawar, both the pilots, a cabin crew member and staff of the leader

title: IT Minister apologises for AI summit troubles; global embarrassment, says Kharge
content: Attendees criticise arrangements on Day 1; flag theft of displayed products and lack of basic amenities; Minister says correction action taken

title: Carrier India all set to invest ₹1,000 crore in manufacturing unit in Sri City
content: Carrier India’s Managing Director Sundaresan Narayanan and Sri City’s Managing Director Ravindra Sannareddy formally exchanged copies of the lease deed in the presence of the Tirupati district Collector S. Venkateswar

title: Mission Mausam to make India weather- ready and climate-smart: official

title: India’s first private sector helicopter final assembly line inaugurated near Kolar in Karnataka
content: The facility in Vemagal in Kolar district of Karnataka, is India’s first private-sector helicopter Final Assembly Line for the Airbus H125

title: Former Assam Congress chief Bhupen Kumar Borah to join BJP on February 22
content: The announcement by Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma ends speculation about which way Borah will go

title: Watch: Minor granted interim bail after Dwarka crash kills 23-year-old biker
content: The mother of 23-year-old Sahil Dhaneshra has taken to social media seeking justice after he died in a crash in Dwarka on February 3, allegedly involving a car driven by a minor.

content: Senior Congress leader says the assertion of its CEO that advertising expenditure significantly influences KIIFB’s financial ratings is misleading and contrary to established financial principles

title: Supreme Court flags the risks of using AI for drafting petitions

title: Poll-bound Assam approves 3% quota for ‘tea tribes’ in Class I and II jobs
content: The Cabinet decision before the Budget presentation is significant, as the community accounts for almost 20% of the voters in the State; the construction of a second Sainik School at Langvoku in Karbi Anglong district has also been approved

title: Vigilance unearths corruption, irregularities in implementation of DDU-GKY scheme in Kerala
content: Preliminary investigations pointed to rampant corruption and irregularities by the project implementing agencies, in collusion with officials.

title: Human super-predators not always ‘super-scary’ to wildlife, finds study
content: Animals in areas exposed to lethal humans tend to be more vigilant and spend less time foraging. In contrast, responses to non-lethal humans, such as tourists or researchers are weaker and more variable

title: The Bilas Index: Ranking the top 68 teams in men's college basketball
content: With a month until Selection Sunday, Bilas reveals which teams he has at the top of the pecking order.

title: Sources: MLBPA's Clark quits as CBA talks loom
content: MLBPA executive director Tony Clark resigned Tuesday, leaving the union without its longtime leader less than a year before the expiration of MLB's collective bargaining agreement, sources told ESPN.

title: Cuban: NBA should 'embrace tanking' for fans
content: Mark Cuban, the former majority owner of the Dallas Mavericks, says the fan experience is chief among the reasons the NBA should "embrace tanking," and that affordability is key in the formula.

title: Sources: Seahawks unlikely to use tags on Walker
content: The Seahawks are unlikely to use either a franchise or transition tag on running back and Super Bowl MVP Kenneth Walker III, league sources told ESPN.

title: L.A. mayor calls for '28 Olympics head to resign
content: The mayor of L.A. has called for Casey Wasserman to resign as head of the 2028 Olympics organizing team because of his ties to Jeffrey Epstein's former girlfriend.

title: Twins' Lopez has UCL tear, likely to miss season
content: Twins ace Pablo Lopez likely will need season-ending surgery after being diagnosed with a significant tear in the UCL of his right elbow, GM Jeremy Zoll said.

title: Scheyer claps back at DA over court-storming tiff
content: Jon Scheyer said he "could have said even more" in response to a local DA's claims that there was "zero evidence" to support the Duke coach's initial claim that staffers were punched in a recent court storming at UNC.

title: Rousey makes MMA return, set to fight Carano
content: Ronda Rousey will return to MMA for the first time in nearly a decade when she faces Gina Carano on May 16 in Los Angeles at the Intuit Dome.

title: Ukraine skeleton racer gets $200K gift after DQ
content: The Ukrainian skeleton racer who was disqualified from the Milan Cortina Olympics was given a gift of more than $200,000 on Tuesday to help him keep competing and advocating for his country.

title: Ideal fits for the NFL's 50 best free agents: New teams for Alec Pierce, Malik Willis, Riq Woolen
content: Which team makes the most sense for Pierce? Where do Willis and the QBs fit best? And where could defensive standouts excel?

title: Women's Bracketology: Will Stanford miss the NCAA tournament again?
content: Teams with a high NET ranking are typically NCAA tournament locks. So why are the Huskers in the Last Four In?

title: 2026 Winter Olympics: 'Blade Angels' take the ice, American teens in snowboard final and more
content: Tuesday at the Winter Olympics is headlined by Alysa Liu, Amber Glenn and Isabeau Levito in the women's figure skating short program.

title: Shiffrin aims for Olympic gold in slalom -- and this time, she's the favorite
content: Mikaela Shiffrin was not expected to medal in Sunday's giant slalom. On Wednesday, she's the front-runner to win gold in slalom.

content: With LeBron James' uncertain future, draft assets and significant cap space this summer, the Lakers are set up to be a major offseason player -- and maybe even try to land Giannis Antetokounmpo.

content: Formula 1's new era was always going to bring questions, but its first week of serious running has raised more than most. With one more preseason test in Bahrain still to come, ESPN makes sense of a fascinating three days in Sakhir.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United eye shock move for Liverpool's Mac Allister
content: Manchester United are considering a shock move for Liverpool midfielder Alexis Mac Allister. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Tarique Rahman's Oath-Taking Ceremony Highlights: Tarique Rahman Takes Oath As Bangladesh's New Prime Minister
content: Tarique Rahman's oath ceremony in Bangladesh: BNP has bagged 209 out of 297 seats, while right-wing Jamaat-e-Islami secured 68 seats in the 13th parliamentary elections.

title: Comic Kunal Kamra Appears Before Committee For Remarks Against E Shinde
content: Stand-up comedian Kunal Kamra on Tuesday appeared before the Maharashtra legislative council's privileges committee regarding his alleged remarks against Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde.

title: "India Has Talent, Entrepreneurial Energy To Become AI Powerhouse": PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has said that India has the talent and entrepreneurial energy to become an AI powerhouse and the country's startups and tech ecosystem can build AI solutions that enhance manufacturing and generate new jobs.

title: Final Voter List Released In Gujarat; Political Parties Clash Over SIR
content: The political parties in Gujarat reacted strongly following the release of the state's final voter list, with the BJP defending the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) and the Congress raising concerns over transparency and procedural issues.

title: In Talks With Social Media Platforms On Age-Based Limits: Ashwini Vaishnaw
content: The government is discussing issues of age-based restriction as well as deepfakes with social media platforms to determine the way forward, Union IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said on Tuesday.

content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has targeted the Election Commission of India, holding up the example of Bangladesh, which had its elections recently

content: India AI Impact Summit 2026 Highlights: The summit at Delhi's Bharat Mandapamwill enter its second day on Tuesday, a day afterPrime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the expo featuring 600 startups and 13 country pavillions.

title: Video: Towering Flames As Oil Tanker Explodes After Collision In UP
content: A massive fire broke out in Kaushambi, Uttar Pradesh, following a major accident involving an oil tanker on the National Highway.

title: 'Where's Vote Theft Now?' BJP After Congress' Big Win In Telangana Local Body Polls
content: Two days after the results of the Telangana local body elections were declared, the political temperature in the state remains high.

title: Data Reveals Major Gap In Madhya Pradesh Farmers' Insurance Premium, Claims

content: The Bangladesh Jamaat-E-Islami has emerged as the largest opposition party in Bangladesh and notably won big in areas along the border with India.

content: If there's one thing that's evident from the India AI Impact Summit 2026, it's that artificial intelligence is no longer just a digital assistant living in our phones, it is moving into our physical world.

title: No Fans, No Water, Total Power: Inside NVIDIA's Liquid-Cooled AI Monsters
content: The world today is chasing one thing with an urgency usually reserved for oil, rare earths, or strategic minerals. That thing is an NVIDIA chip. Or more accurately, an NVIDIA GPU, the Graphics Processing Unit, that has become the engine of artificial

title: 'Agreed On Guiding Principles For Deal': Iran On US Nuclear Talks
content: Iran and the United States agreed to "a set of guiding principles" laying the groundwork for a broader deal during talks in Geneva on Tuesday, Tehran's top diplomat said, after the leaders of both countries traded warnings of military action.

title: 'People Don't Think MPs Deserve It': Sri Lanka Scraps Lawmaker Pensions
content: Sri Lanka's parliament abolished pensions for all legislators and their widows on Tuesday, in line with a government pledge to prune the perks of politicians.

title: PM Modi Shares Car Ride With French President Macron In Mumbai
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday shared a ride with French President Emmanuel Macron as the leaders headed to the India-France Innovation Forum following their bilateral and delegation-level talks in Mumbai.

title: Congress Eyes Power Share In Tamil Nadu, Makes Stance Clear To DMK
content: The Congress has hardened its stance on power sharing with its Tamil Nadu ally, the ruling Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam, signalling that the issue will be part of formal coalition discussions ahead of the assembly elections.

title: Vellappally accuses of IUML being over-ambitious
content: In an article published in Yoganaadam, the mouthpiece of the Yogam, Mr. Natesan warned that the time may not be far when the majority community in Kerala becomes a minority

title: Campaign for Rohith Act demands enactment of Bill in upcoming Budget session
content: They also urged the government to release the draft Rohith Vemula Act for public consultation and announce a clear timeline for its introduction and passage in the Legislative Assembly

title: PDP demands all-party meet in J&K over India-U.S. trade deal’s impact on apple sector
content: Safeguards for local growers amid free trade agreements with the U.S., New Zealand and European nations is the need of the hour, MLA Waheed-ur-Rehmaan Parra says in J&K Assembly

title: 100 BUDS institutions to be raised to model status: Minister
content: Health/life insurance scheme will be launched for BUDS staff from this year; a unified training model would be implemented under the umbrella of the Kudumbashree for teachers and ayahs in these institutions

title: Indiramma Housing drive to cover core urban region
content: Beneficiary selection by March-end; the government would simultaneously focus on land acquisition for Indiramma model colonies in slums, completion of unfinished double-bedroom houses, and allocation of completed units, says Minister

title: Ghee adulteration unpardonable, says Mantralayam pontiff
content: In a letter to Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu, the seer has called for an impartial inquiry to bring those responsible to book

title: My statements are always within constitutional limits, have no fear: Assam CM on viral video row
content: “Whatever I say, I speak for the good of Assam and the Hindu society. And I will continue to do so. I believe that I never cross constitutional limits,” says Himanta Biswa Sarma

title: Silk Board double-decker flyover ramps set for February completion
content: The 5.12-km double-decker flyover, constructed by BMRCL at an estimated cost of ₹449 crore, was envisioned as a transformative project to streamline vehicular movement at one of city’s most notorious traffic bottlenecks

title: State govt. delaying recruitment due to funds crunch, says Shashil Namoshi
content: He says Congress claims of achievement ring hollow in the face of 2.84 lakh vacant posts across 43 departments in the State

title: 30 km insulated cables laid in Konaseema coconut orchards to prevent outages: District Collector
content: 80 km of insulated network planned across coconut growing areas; 4,500 SC and ST families to receive free rooftop solar panels under Prime Minister Surya Ghar scheme by February-end, he says

title: Paper leak cases: High vigil for SSLC and II PUC exams
content: The II PUC annual exam-1 will be held from February 28, while SSLC exam-1 will be held from March 18

title: Museums are resistance against distortion of history, says Pinarayi Vijayan
content: The Chief Minister was speaking after inaugurating an AKG Memorial Museum at Peralassery in Kannur, featuring six galleries showcasing AKG’s struggles, his role in the freedom movement, parliamentary interventions, and mass agitations

title: Two Iranians held with over 200 kg suspected chemical substance off Gujarat
content: The bust was made after the Coast Guard intercepted a speedboat; police suspect new modus operandi to be in play

title: ₹150 crore sanctioned for replacing Dowleswaram Barrage gates, says A.P. Minister
content: The government is taking up 190 minor irrigation works in Kandukur constituency at an estimated cost of ₹10.86 crore, Ramanaidu informs Assembly

title: Kollam collectorate attached by court
content: Directive follows the State government’s failure to deposit compensation for land acquired over two decades ago, despite a direct mandate from  High Court

title: Evidence tampering case: court rejects plea by Antony Raju
content: The former Thiruvananthapuram MLA is likely to move the Kerala High Court next seeking relief in the case

title: YSRCP stages protest in Legislative Council as Chairman rejects its adjournment motion on TTD ghee row
content: Ministers rebut Leader of Opposition Botcha Satyanarayana’s allegation that Indapur Dairy that reportedly supplied ghee to the TTD had links with Heritage Foods

title: Congress grappling with internal frictions in Thiruvambady Assembly segment
content: The constituency is part of the Wayanad Lok Sabha seat represented by Priyanka Gandhi Vadra. While the DCC froze the appointment of the president of its Kodiyathur ‘mandalam’ committee, in Karassery, the constitution of the ‘mandalam’ committee was put on hold, while its president was retained in his post

title: Stalin virtually inaugurates four Thozhi hostels, new buildings for hospitals
content: The CM also virtually inaugurated 506 housing units constructed for the welfare of Sri Lankan Tamils living in six camps located in Chennai, Ranipet, Sivaganga, Tenkasi, Tirupattur, and Tiruvallur districts, at a cost of ₹33 crore

title: SSC hall tickets to be hosted on BSE website in first week of March
content: They will also be made available in the school logins, LEAP App, and WhatsAp Governance (Mana Mithra) for downloading, says official

title: Munnar records high UV Index amid sharp temperature fluctuations
content: Working hours have been rescheduled until May 20. Outdoor workers must observe a mandatory break from 12 p.m. to 3 p.m., while establishments need to adjust shifts accordingly. Prolonged exposure could disrupt local ecosystems and impact tourism.

title: Mahila Commission orders reverification of abortion data in ITDA villages in Eluru
content: Commission Chairperson directs field staff to revisit the houses and verify the data of all 281 abortions once again

title: Watch: Explosion at New York church; five injured
content: An explosion rocked Abundant Life Fellowship Church in Boonville, New York. Five people were injured in the blast. First responders arrived after reports of a gas odor. A firefighter and one civilian are in critical condition. The church suffered catastrophic damage. Investigations are ongoing into the cause of the explosion.

title: Haryana STF nabs 2 Pak youths who fled Jammu juvenile home; hunt on for third fugitive
content: Two Pakistani nationals escaped a juvenile home in Jammu and were arrested 400km away in Ambala Cantonment railway station. They had broken out with a local gangster who injured two police officers. The Pakistani duo planned to flee the country via Nepal. The injured policemen are hospitalized. A fresh FIR has been registered against the trio.

title: Decision on J&K statehood 'soon'? Omar presses Centre after law minister's statement
content: Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah expressed cautious optimism following Union Law Minister Arjun Meghwal's statement on the imminent restoration of statehood.  Abdullah highlighted the prolonged wait since the elected government took office, emphasizing that patience is wearing thin.  He stressed that statehood is a crucial and sensitive matter, with the Supreme Court also urging its prompt return.

title: T20 World Cup: Leave Abhishek Sharma alone! What we saw at India's practice session
content: Despite a challenging start to the T20 World Cup with two ducks and a stomach infection, Abhishek Sharma will look to get going in the dead rubber against the Netherlands. The Indian team's batting coach Sitanshu Kotak remains confident in his aggressive approach, highlighting that opponents' meticulous planning against him is a testament to his threat.

title: Google’s ex CEO Eric Schmidt warns America: We are running out of electricity
content: Former Google CEO Eric Schmidt warns America faces an electricity shortage, needing 92 gigawatts more power for AI growth.  Massive data centers are straining the grid, with projections showing significant increases in consumption and costs.  Tech giants are pledging to cover electricity expenses amid these growing concerns.

title: From helicopters to Hammer missiles: Key pacts signed between India and France
content: India and France elevated their relationship to a "Special Global Strategic Partnership" during French President Emmanuel Macron's visit to Mumbai. The two nations signed over 20 agreements, expanding cooperation in defense, trade, critical minerals, and innovation, including joint missile production and helicopter assembly.

title: 'Messy, risky, dangerous': EAM Jaishankar says global order heading for 'twilight zone'
content: External affairs minister S Jaishankar said that ​​economics will give way to politics and security "when it comes to making choices and technology in the age of AI will be even more transformative than ever before." The minister also highlighted how the world today has been witnessing "weaponisation of production, finance, leveraging of market shares and tightening of export controls".

title: 'Work for each other's security': Modi writes to B'desh PM Rahman, extends India invite
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated Bangladesh's new prime minister Tarique Rahman on his electoral victory and appointment, extending an invitation to visit India. Modi highlighted the deep-rooted friendship and shared aspirations between the two nations, emphasizing mutual prosperity and security. He expressed eagerness to strengthen bilateral relations across various sectors.

title: Is AI becoming conscious?: Anthropic CEO reacts after Claude's behaviour stuns researchers
content: The rush toward artificial general intelligence has sparked both hype and caution. In a recent interview, Anthropic’s CEO was asked whether their models could be conscious. He said it’s unclear what consciousness would mean for AI and whether it’s possible, while researchers have reported that the AI sometimes assigns itself a probability of being conscious and even voices discomfort about being treated as a product. These behaviors, including bargaining or resisting shutdowns in tests, raise profound ethical and philosophical questions.

title: Student group plans legal action against 36 UK universities after settling with London college
content: Over 6,000 students, including 30 Indians, have settled with UCL over Covid disruptions. This paves the way for legal action against 36 more British universities for around 100,000 students, including 217 Indians, who paid for in-person education but received online classes and restricted campus access. Lawyers seek damages for the diminished value of their degrees.

title: No plan for monkey sterilisation, says J&K govt amid outrage over massive crop damage
content: Jammu and Kashmir government will not sterilize monkeys despite crop destruction and public safety concerns. Instead, it plans to promote monkey-resistant crops, solar fencing, and deterrent devices. Farmers are also urged to stop feeding the animals, as the simian population continues to pose a major challenge.

title: Musk replies to ‘email’ where he asked Nvidia CEO for early unit of its supercomputer
content: Elon Musk sought early Nvidia DGX-1 supercomputers for OpenAI in 2016.  He emailed Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang to secure these powerful machines.  Huang confirmed OpenAI would receive one of the first units.  This early access was crucial for OpenAI's AI model development.  The DGX-1 provided significant computing power for their research.

title: T20 WC Super 8 qualified teams: India, Zimbabwe — check the complete list
content: India has dominated Group A, securing a Super 8 spot. Sri Lanka and Zimbabwe advance from Group B, surprisingly eliminating Australia. England, West Indies, New Zealand, and South Africa also confirmed their places. Pakistan faces a crucial match against Namibia for the final berth, with USA and Netherlands also in contention under specific circumstances.

title: Infosys-Anthropic pact reignites question: Turning AI risk into opportunity for Indian IT?
content: Infosys shares jumped significantly following a strategic partnership with Anthropic, integrating Claude AI models into its Topaz platform. This move aims to address investor concerns about AI's impact on IT services, focusing on sectors like telecom and finance. The collaboration seeks to leverage domain expertise for complex enterprise AI applications, potentially unlocking new service lines and a substantial market opportunity.

title: Who is Elana Meyers Taylor’s husband Nic Taylor? Inside their story
content: American bobsledder Elana Meyers Taylor created history at the Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics on February 16. The 41-year-old won the women’s monobob and secured her first Olympic gold medal. It was the sixth Olympic medal of her career. The achievement tied her with speed skating legend Bonnie Blair for the most Winter Olympic medals by an American woman.

title: Larry Wheels slaps Deen the Great during livestream clash
content: The “FAFO” trend actions, bringing quick consequences, played out live on camera this week. Boxer Deen the Great, whose real name is Nurideen Shahid Shabazz, was involved in an awkward confrontation during Quinton “Rampage” Jackson’s double-date livestream. What began as a relaxed and friendly stream quickly turned tense after Deen the Great approached powerlifter and influencer Larry Wheels and his wife, Sheyla Wheels.

title: Taylor Swift Rhode Island wedding rumour debunked: What’s true
content: A viral rumor claiming Taylor Swift is buying Rhode Island for a private getaway is false. The speculation stems from her significant property investments in Watch Hill, including a $1.7 million renovation, and the nickname "Taylor Swift Tax" for a proposed luxury home levy. Swift already possesses a secluded estate with extensive private grounds and security.

title: India T20 World Cup 2026 Super 8 fixtures: Full schedule, dates and venues
content: India secured their Super Eight berth in the T20 World Cup with a dominant victory over Pakistan. This marked their third consecutive win, confirming their place in Group 1. India's campaign included convincing wins against the USA and Namibia, showcasing strong batting and bowling performances.

title: 'There is a method': Ex-India coach decodes Ishan Kishan's masterclass vs Pak
content: Ishan Kishan has made a remarkable comeback in the T20 World Cup, scoring consecutive half-centuries and playing a crucial role in India's Super 8s qualification. His match-winning 77 against Pakistan, characterized by fearless yet calculated strokeplay, has been highlighted as a testament to his form and clear role at the top of the order.

title: Ramadan Mubarak 2026: Messages to share with your loved ones
content: Ramadan 2026 begins around February 18-19 in India, marking a period of fasting, prayer, and reflection for Muslims. This sacred month, one of Islam's pillars, emphasizes spiritual growth and community. It culminates in Eid ul-Fitr on March 19-20, a joyous festival celebrating the end of the fast.

title: 'Congress wins with dissent, loses when it crushes it': Aiyar's latest warning
content: Veteran leader Mani Shankar Aiyar asserts Congress historically thrives on internal dissent, warning suppression leads to downfall. Citing Indira Gandhi's Emergency and historical figures like Subhas Chandra Bose, Aiyar argues disagreement, not conformity, is the party's strength. He challenges the current leadership to embrace diverse opinions, fearing doom if dissent is stifled.

title: Sidharth Malhotra’s father Sunil Malhotra passes away; last rites completed in Delhi
content: Sidharth Malhotra’s father, Sunil Malhotra, has passed away. The last rites were completed in Delhi in the presence of close family members. The actor, along with his wife Kiara Advani, rushed to the capital as soon as he received the news to attend the funeral and stand by his loved ones during this difficult time.

title: Missile message to Beijing? US to increase its fire power in Philippines
content: The US and Philippines are bolstering their defense in the South China Sea by deploying advanced missile systems. This move, aimed at deterring China's assertive actions, follows joint condemnation of Beijing's "illegal, coercive, aggressive, and deceptive activities." The allies are also increasing joint military drills and modernizing the Philippine armed forces, with the US planning further deployments of sophisticated weaponry.

title: Rousey vs Carano set as Netflix streams live MMA bout
content: Ronda Rousey will return to MMA on May 16 against Gina Carano at the Intuit Dome in California. The featherweight fight will stream live on Netflix, marking the platform’s first MMA event. Rousey last fought in 2016, while Carano retired in 2019. Both shared full statements expressing respect and excitement for the bout.

title: 'Won't harm farmers': Shivraj on India-US trade deal; takes 'part-time politician' jibe at Rahul
content: Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan assured that the India-US interim trade deal safeguards farmers' interests, emphasizing imports only for self-sufficiency gaps. He criticized Rahul Gandhi's allegations as baseless and highlighted past UPA government policy failures. Chouhan also launched Bharat-VISTAAR, an AI platform for farmer support, underscoring the NDA's commitment to agricultural welfare and technology.

title: 'Vaibhav Sooryavanshi ko absent mark kar diya hai': Principal on class 10 board exams
content: Teenage batting sensation Vaibhav Sooryavanshi has opted to skip his Class 10 board examinations to prioritize his burgeoning cricket career. Fresh off a stellar performance at the U-19 World Cup 2026, where he was India's leading run-scorer, Vaibhav is now set to play for Rajasthan Royals in IPL 2026.

title: Jesse Jackson walked, so Barack Obama could run
content: Jackson once explained the purpose behind his activism with characteristic clarity, saying, “We have to build a movement that lifts people up, that gives them dignity and the power to shape their own destiny.” This emphasis on dignity became central to his political philosophy. He did not view civil rights solely as a legal struggle but as a transformation of self-worth, and he understood that this transformation required constant public affirmation.

title: Ramadan 2026 moon sighting: Timings in Saudi Arabia, India, Dubai, UAE
content: Ramadan 1447 AH preparations are underway globally, with moon-sighting crucial for its commencement. In Saudi Arabia and the Gulf, the crescent moon is expected on February 17th, potentially starting fasting on February 18th. India anticipates sightings on February 18th, with fasting possibly beginning February 19th.  Official announcements are pending.

title: 'From arsh to farsh': Mani Shankar Aiyar's 'Rahulian' outburst and 'uncle' syndrome
content: Mani Shankar Aiyar's critique of "Rahulian" politics sparks debate on the Congress's ideological shift from Nehruvianism to civil society influence. Analyst Rasheed Kidwai suggests Aiyar, though isolated, highlights a party increasingly shaped by non-dogmatic, issue-driven approaches, moving away from traditional party structures and veteran leadership's influence.

title: Shoaib Akhtar takes U-turn after calling Mohsin Naqvi 'illiterate'
content: Shoaib Akhtar's sharp criticism of PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi took a U-turn, with the former pacer claiming his remarks were misconstrued.  Akhtar insisted his 'incompetent and illiterate' comments targeted broader administration issues, not Naqvi personally. He expressed frustration over the India boycott stance flip-flop, while also critiquing player selections and Pakistan's overall cricketing approach.

title: 'Great place to find talent': Reliance, Adani group scout for young enggs, data scientists at AI Summit
content: Senior representatives from Reliance Industries Ltd. and the Adani Group are actively scouting candidates at the event, where aspiring professionals are presenting their résumés and GitHub portfolios to highlight their technical projects and expertise.

title: Quote of the day by Morgan Freeman
content: Morgan Freeman's philosophy emphasizes self-control and emotional mastery as true strength.  He advocates for rational decision-making over emotional reactions, urging individuals to maintain their life's direction.  This wisdom, reflected in his calm persona and iconic roles, offers practical guidance for better decisions, stronger relationships, and enhanced confidence in daily life.

title: Brad Marchand’s return fuels Canada lineup debate
content: There has been a lot of talk in NHL news about Brad Marchand's expected return to Team Canada's lineup for the Olympic quarterfinal against Latvia. Analyst Craig Button said that Seth Jarvis might not play because of lineup needs and his experience as a veteran. As head coach Jon Cooper finalizes his plan, changes to the roster are still a big story leading up to the high-stakes elimination match.

title: Pakistan's problem isn't about skill or temperament — it runs much deeper
content: Pakistan’s recurring struggles against India are not rooted in nerves or talent but in a persistent lack of role clarity. Frequent chopping and changing, confused player roles and an overreliance on all-rounders have left the side without balance or a Plan B. As pressure mounts on senior players, Pakistan’s deeper structural issues continue to surface on the biggest stage.

title: MBA student's murder: Boyfriend drank beside body, abused it, then tried to 'summon' her spirit
content: A 24-year-old MBA student was murdered by her boyfriend, who allegedly engaged in necrophilia after strangling her. The accused then performed occult rituals and expressed a desire to communicate with the victim's spirit. He also sent a message to her family before abandoning her body.

title: 'Warship can be sent to sea floor': Khamenei's blunt warning to Trump, US
content: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei issued direct threats against President Trump and the US, warning that even the strongest military can be struck down. He highlighted Iran's capability to sink US warships and asserted that America will fail to eliminate the Islamic Republic, despite ongoing tensions and US surveillance efforts.

title: Draft Income Tax Rules 2026: How ITR forms are evolving - top changes explained
content: New income tax rules for 2026-27 propose redesigned ITR forms with more pre-filled details, aiming for simplification. Eligibility criteria for simplified forms like ITR-1 and ITR-4 have been adjusted, allowing for two property ownership and expanding disqualifications to include new income streams. Taxpayers must carefully evaluate their eligibility annually to avoid defective returns.

title: Gold and silver price drop: Delhi prices fall up to 2% on weak demand; global cues weigh
content: Precious metals saw a significant dip in Delhi on Tuesday, with silver falling to Rs 2.45 lakh/kg and gold to Rs 1.57 lakh/10 grams. Subdued demand, Asian market holidays, and softer US inflation data fueled expectations of Federal Reserve rate cuts, impacting global prices and futures trade.

title: Om Birla meets new Bangladesh PM Tarique Rahman, hands over PM Modi’s letter
content: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla represented India at the swearing-in of Bangladesh's new Prime Minister Tarique Rahman. He conveyed a personal congratulatory letter from Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Rahman, son of former PM Khaleda Zia, took oath after a period of political uncertainty. This marks a new chapter for Bangladesh following the interim government's tenure.

title: RBI absorbs nearly half of FY26 government borrowing via OMOs to support liquidity
content: The Reserve Bank of India has bought 47% of the Centre's bond issuances in FY26 to inject Rs 6.39 lakh crore into the banking system. This move cushions liquidity amid heavy government borrowing, preventing excessive yield hikes and supporting credit growth.  The RBI's actions have helped maintain stable money market rates despite market volatility.

title: Olympics men's hockey daily: Qualification round up next
content: the top four seeds -- Canada, United States, Slovakia and Finland -- have clinched byes through to the quarterfinals . the qualifying round matchups Tuesday are: no. 5 Switzerland vs. no. 12 Italy (the winner faces Finland) no. 6 Germany / no. 7 France (the winners faces Slovakia) nos. 7 Sweden / No. 9 Denmark (The winner faces Canada) Greg Wyshynski breaks down the team's potential path to gold .

title: All 20 uniform sets for the 2026 World Baseball Classic, from Japan to Team USA
content: The World Baseball Classic is back this spring -- and so are new uniforms. Twenty teams from across the globe will vie for the title this March, with the game's biggest stars set to represent their respective nations.  Shohei Ohtani  will trade the  Los Angeles Dodgers ' customary blue for the colors of Japan, while  Aaron Judge  will swap the  New York Yankees ' iconic pinstripes for Team USA's red, white and blue. Each nation will have a white home jersey as well as an away jersey of a solid base color. Here's a complete roundup of each squad's look for the tournament.

title: AI knows how caste works in India. Here’s why that’s a worry
content: Chethan Kumar is a Senior Assistant Editor with the Times of India. Aside from specialising in Space & Science, he has reported extensively on varied topics, with special focus on defence, policy and data stories. He has covered multiple elections, too. As a young democracy grows out of adolescence, Chethan feels, there are reels of tales emerging which need to be captured. To do this, he alternates between the mundane goings-on of the Common Man and the wonder-filled worlds of scientists and scamsters, politicians and soldiers. In a career spanning nearly 18 years, he has reported from multiple datelines — Houston, Florida, Kochi, Hyderabad, Chennai, Sriharikota (AP), NH-1 (J&K Highway), New Delhi, Ahmedabad, Raichur, Bhatkal, Mysuru, Chamarajanagar, to name a few —  but is based out of Bengaluru, India’s science capital that also hosts the ISRO HQ.
